#### 1.1 Repository Layout

The RED-X app is organized into clearly defined folders for modularity:

app/ – Core app logic and structure (UI, server, data, tabs)

docs/ – Quarto-based documentation for users and developers

www/ – Static files (images, logos, assets)

renv/ – Package dependencies managed using renv

Explorer_cache.db – SQLite database file for cached metadata

#### 1.2 Key Files and Scripts

UI.R & server.R – Main application UI and server logic

global.R – Global configuration, including shared resources

appFunction/ – Helper functions (e.g., data fetching, transformation)

appTabs/ – UI layout of individual tabs (e.g., Home, Network, Metadata)

#### 1.3 Modular Design

Tabs are modularized into separate scripts for readability and reuse. Example:

source("./app/appTabs/homeTab.R")

### 2.0 Getting Started

#### 2.1 Prerequisites

R version >= 4.2

RStudio (recommended)

Internet access for API calls

#### 2.2 Setup Instructions

git clone https://github.com/agrifooddatacanada/OAC_Historical_Research_Data_Explorer_App.git
setwd("OAC_Historical_Research_Data_Explorer_App")
renv::restore()

#### 2.3 Running the App

shiny::runApp("./app")

### 3.0 API Integration

#### 3.1 Overview

RED-X uses the Borealis Dataverse API to fetch study metadata, authorship, keywords, and files.

#### 3.2 API Token

Your API token is stored in an environment variable:

Sys.getenv("API_TOKEN")

⚠️ Never hardcode your API token. Permissions vary by user level.

#### 3.3 API Functions

fetch_all_datasets() – Recursively fetches datasets from Dataverse

fetch_study_details() – Pulls metadata using persistent DOIs

access_data() – Downloads file bundles (ZIP) from Dataverse

### 4.0 Database and Data Handling

#### 4.1 Local SQLite Cache

The app stores metadata locally for fast loading:

dbConnect(SQLite(), "Explorer_cache.db")

#### 4.2 Key Tables

research_data – Main table with metadata and links

update_info – Tracks last sync time

college_colors / department_colors – Categorical color maps

keywords_node, keywords_edge – Nodes and edges for network graph

#### 4.3 Scheduled Updates

Every 48 hours:

API is called

Metadata is refreshed

Cache is merged and updated in SQLite

### 5.0 UI and UX Design

#### 5.1 Layout

Navbar and sidebar-driven interface

Each tab supports interactivity and filtering

#### 5.2 Modules

Tabs include:

Home

Network Explorer

Data Explorer

Metadata Viewer

### 6.0 Deployment

#### 6.1 Platform

The app is hosted publicly on shinyapps.io

#### 6.2 Deployment Steps

Log in to shinyapps.io

Deploy from RStudio using rsconnect::deployApp()

### 7.0 Contributing

#### 7.1 Coding Standards

Follow tidyverse style

Keep code modular

Comment your logic

#### 7.2 Submitting Changes

Fork and branch

Submit PR with description

### 8.0 Additional Notes

Documentation is generated using Quarto

Visit the GitHub Repo for full code

All diagrams are stored in docs/images/
